verses.verse: Where is your beloved<WH1730> gone<WH1980>, O you fairest<WH3303> among women<WH802>? where is your beloved<WH1730> turned aside<WH6437>? that we may seek him with you<WH1245>.
My beloved<WH1730> is gone down<WH3381> into his garden<WH1588>, to the beds<WH6170> of spices<WH1314>, to feed<WH7462> in the gardens<WH1588>, and to gather<WH3950> lilies<WH7799>.
I am my beloved<WH1730>'s, and my beloved<WH1730> is mine<WH7462>: he feeds among the lilies<WH7799>.
You are beautiful<WH3303>, O my love<WH7474>, as Tirzah<WH8656>, fitting<WH5000> as Jerusalem<WH3389>, terrible<WH366> as a army with banners<WH1713>.
Turn away<WH5437> your eyes<WH5869> from me<WH1992>, for they have overcome<WH7292> me<WH8181>: your hair is as a flock<WH5739> of goats<WH5795> that appear<WH1570> from Gilead<WH1568>.
Your teeth<WH8127> are as a flock<WH5739> of sheep<WH7353> which go up<WH5927> from the washing<WH7367>, whereof every one bears twins<WH8382>, and there is not one childless among them<WH7909>.
As a piece<WH6400> of a pomegranate<WH7416> are your temples<WH7541> inside<WH1157> your locks<WH6777>.
There are sixty<WH8346> queens<WH4436>, and eighty<WH8084> concubines<WH6370>, and virgins<WH5959> without number<WH4557>.

My dove<WH3123>, my undefiled<WH8535> is but one<WH259>; she is the only one<WH259> of her mother<WH517>, she is the choice<WH1249> one of her that bore<WH3205> her<WH1323>. The daughters saw<WH7200> her<WH833>, and blessed her<WH4436>; Yes, the queens and the concubines<WH6370>, and they praised her<WH1984>.
Who is she that looks forth<WH8259> as the morning<WH7837>, fair<WH3303> as the moon<WH3842>, clear<WH1249> as the sun<WH2535>, and terrible<WH366> as a army with banners<WH1713>?

I went down<WH3381> into the garden<WH1594> of nuts<WH93> to see<WH7200> the fruits<WH3> of the valley<WH5158>, and to see<WH7200> whether the vine<WH1612> flourished<WH6524>, and the pomegranates<WH7416> budded<WH5132>.
Or ever I was aware<WH3045>, my soul<WH5315> made<WH7760> me like the chariots<WH4818> of Amminadib<WH5993>.

Return<WH7725>, return<WH7725>, O Shulamite<WH7759>; return<WH7725>, return<WH7725>, that we may look<WH2372> upon you<WH2372>. What will you see in the Shulamite<WH7759>? As it were the company<WH4246> of two armies<WH4264>.
